website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive buy that works well as long as it's protected.
pros: This top-rated, well-made seat offers smooth gliding motion in a simple design
Can be put together quickly with little sweat to add outdoor seating to property that will last for years with no maintenance required
cons: Rusting makes this bench more suited to covered environments

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Slats on bench have warped. If I could send it back I would!!
customer_reviews.author: Ann H.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I have reached out for assistance to help get an issue resolved with no one even trying to help me. I ordered this for my mother for her birthday. It arrived, it was put together and then it started to warp and pull away from the metal frame. The part that pulled away was the seat and it was already assembled when the box was opened. All I wanted was help and no one offered any. Now my mother, who loved this glider can't even enjoy it. It was beautiful and very comfy, but now it looks like it's been on her deck for years, not weeks.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ridenour

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: We have had this glider for 6 weeks, but it has only been in use about 3 weeks and it is already coming apart. A slat has popped up, and it looks like the hardware used to attach it to the glider has snapped in half. Short of welding the slat down (not a skill either my husband not myself has), we are not able to repair the glider. What a dissappointment. LifeTime needs a new name. Unless you are an insect, this glider will not last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful (when it isn't broken).
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love it. It was making a bit of a squeak with multiple adults on it. Some 3 in 1 oil and one minute later and it never made a squeak again. Extremely sturdy. Looks great. But.... We ordered one and it came in with a broken front slat on the seat. Returned that one and re-odered another and it came with the exact same issue. Wasn't going to try a third time so I called the manufacturer and they said they'd send a replacement slat for free.
customer_reviews.author: Mystchyphe

customer_reviews.title: Rust! Better keep it covered!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn't too bad but this glider is a pain to move, slides on composite decking and began to rust immediately (I just didn't notice in time to return through Amazon). Good for a covered area on concrete or grass only. I expect more from the Lifetime name. 11 months later and the glider is also filling with water and drips rusty water which has ruined a marble top (made mistake of lifting over the table in the dark) table and some of our pavers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and looks good, but after about a month of use two of the slats at the seat broke off and raised up. Not too hard to glue down with epoxy, but I shouldn't have to do this. Not exactly a lifetime product. Edit: Third slat broke loose. One is bad, two is ridiculous, three is unacceptable. Very poor quality control and lousy design for slat attachment.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This glider is heavy duty and looks like it will hold up to weather. When the glider was delivered on of the slats in the seat was broken, the reason for 4 stars on sturdiness. I called the manufacturer. A new slat was delivered within a week. The glider is sturdy and glides smoothly. It is comfortable for one person. Might be a little snug for two adults. I had someone else assemble it for me. He was able to put it together pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: The bolts at the end were smashed (3 out of 4) which made it impossible to put the screw on. This bench won't glide without securing these bolts. I was very disappointed when the damaged glider bench arrived. I order very often from Amazon and I can't remember the last time I received a damaged product.
customer_reviews.author: MartyMar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, very comfortable to sit on
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. We looked for a glider rocker for 2 years and finally gave up. We found this item on Amazon and decided to give it a try. When it arrived I took all the parts out of the box and laid on the garage floor. The instructions were easy to follow and I had it put together in about an hour. It looks great on our front porch and I like that the seat is made from recycled material and will not need painting.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fair

customer_reviews.title: Roomy comfortable bench
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. I have had the same one on my front porch since 2008. Recently when looking for a bench for the back yard I ordered the same bench because of the glider. Bench sits back a little not straight up. Very comfortable for a metal bench. We fit 3people and cat on this bench all at the same time. It will definitely fit a couple sitting together and enjoying nature.
customer_reviews.author: Mic

customer_reviews.title: Conflicted About Quality
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally review products, however I’m somewhat disappointed... Have had to fix several slats (broken screws, used epoxy on slat backs where screws broke off some materials)... this is disappointing considering the price & the name (Lifetime) of the product. Otherwise the product is quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: jpc

customer_reviews.title: Rusted Screws - Boards Popping Up After 2 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old daughter and I assembled this with ease. I was rather excited about the purchase ... until just 2 weeks after setting it up the front board of the seat was popping up! Upon further inspection I found not one but two rusted screws busted in half. I was able to get the rusted screws out of board. I should be able to reassemble the searvwith new screws from the hardware store, but this is rather disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Long Legs

customer_reviews.title: I needed help to assemble it
customer_reviews.text: Our family really likes this new glider that replaces our 30-year-old wooden one. The materials will last longer and look better as it ages. We won't have to replace wood, add braces, or paint & repaint. The materials are top quality. Our small dogs can sit on the bench without their paws slipping thru, although they usually chill out in the shade underneath. I took off one star on the review because I had to ask for help to assemble it. Maybe that won't matter to most folks because this is a great bench.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but be prepared to use your own tools. Its doesn't take many.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is a quality product. My wife and I assembled ours today. Its solidly built and good looking. On the other hand, the tools they provide for the assembly are useless. The little 10x8mm open end wrench is about three inches long. Using that combined with the little screw driver, Allen wrench combo to tighten all of the nuts would have been a nightmare. Luckly I had "real tools" so it went together in about 20 minutes. I'm not saying don't buy this item. Its great, just be ready to use your own tools. Its doesn't take many.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: You need your own tools
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it's possible to assemble with the provided tools, but I wouldn't count on it. You need an 8 mm and 10 mm crescent or socket wrench, a 4 mm Allen wrench, and a Phillip's screwdriver. I was able to assemble it by myself but it would have been easier with a second person. Now that it's done I'm very happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Ookoo

customer_reviews.title: Glider by Lifetime - Do Not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together; comes with its own tool. Very sturdy. About a month into the seat slats a popping out. Appears the self anchored screws they used ate rusted in half. Heck to get the half out of the slat and TRY to anchor it with another screw. Poor materials and workmanship.

customer_reviews.title: bad slates and screws
customer_reviews.text: This glider was pretty easy to assemble, but it didn't last 48 hours. The second day we went to sit on the glider, one of the planks had popped two screws and were buckled. My husband took it apart and replaced with bigger screws. Five days later, without use, two more boards are popping up and the original screws were broken. My husband is attempting to take it completely apart and replace all screws at this point. If it weren't a hassle to send back, we would have returned it. We will never use this brand again or order furniture from Amazon in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Bee

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The glider is exactly as advertised. It was a little difficult to assemble in that it required two people and the tools weren’t that sturdy. We had to revert to my toolbox for a wrench and screwdriver. Otherwise, the finished product is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Carousel

customer_reviews.title: Seat falling apart
customer_reviews.text: It’s been outside for a little under two months and several of the seat boards are popping off, the screws are rusting and breaking Going to call lifetime to see what they will do, major defect do not purchase! Will update when I know more.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but didn't hold up in Arizona sun.
customer_reviews.text: I love this BBQ cover. It was huge (covered by rotisserie attachment and side BBQ lamp. The straps secured it down from being blown off. It looked good too. The front flap completely covered and protected the knobs.But alas, The Arizona sunshine and heat caused it to dry out, crack and disintegrate! I had registered the warranty. I will be contacting the manufacturer to see if it can be replaced or at least prorated. I want another one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lou Ridgeway

customer_reviews.title: Glider bench
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy glinder bench, fit the purpose for what I need it
customer_reviews.author: ROSA BOGART

customer_reviews.title: Not a lifetime bench, lasted seven months.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bench August 2015, it's on our deck. It's probably only been sat on less than five times. The planks on the bench is coming loose due to the screws rusting and breaking. Two have already broken and I'm sure more will break in time. Not really sure how I can resecure them due to the way they broke off leaving half of the screw is in the wood. The bench looks and sits great but probably not going to get much use out of it considering how quickly it started to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery C.White

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: WE have had this glider for less than a year and the slats are pulling up thus breaking the screws. The screws can't be replaced because the screws break inside the slats and can't be removed. Would not recommend this product at all. Will contact the company for replacements slats.
customer_reviews.author: Fuji 2

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be very sturdy and I like the look of it
customer_reviews.text: I received my glider on 9/13/2017. It seems to be very sturdy and I like the look of it. The only issue that I had was the tools that were provided. I received a small hex tool and tiny open-end wrench. Because they were so tiny and it required a bit of force to tighten the bolts, I ended up stripped some of the bolts, which was frustrating. Luckily, I have my own tools and was able to tighten everything down with my own wrench and drill. I would suggest using your own tools from start to finish. Otherwise, good looking/functioning glider.
customer_reviews.author: Derek D.

customer_reviews.title: it's our little getaway...
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these. We really like them. One on the porch and one under a tree in the yard. (I will post a picture if I can). Like most lifetime products they are well made and should last a long time. If you are looking for a nice glider, this is the chair for you. I heard some reviews that talked about damage, but we had both units show up in perfect condition and went together easily. Not much else to say.. Thank you for your time.
customer_reviews.author: Henry G.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Adding another to the long list of complaints from people who have had boards warp and detach from the frame. We've had this since late April and it had a few boards on the seat of the bench warp within the first month. Filed a claim with the seller and they replaced it, same issue on the replacement seat within another few months and pretty low use. Mind you these seats come pre-assembled, you attach it to the rest of the frame but the boards are already attached to the metal, so there is no possibility of user assembly error here. The brand name being Lifetime is an absolute joke.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dean

customer_reviews.title: Good Glider!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Seat and back pre-assembled. Screws and nuts/bolts all there, but pictures caused confusion and. Caused some back-tracking on assembly. Otherwise good instructions. Real wrenches made assembly quite simple. Unit is atteactive, sturdy and used Daily !
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I love the bench. Easy to put together with instructions. We didn't use the tools included because it would of taken us all day to put together. My only complaint is that there is orange liquid after it rains coming out from where the screws are on one side. Don't think it is rust but very strange. That is why I gave it a 4 star. Otherwise it is a great glider.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking bench but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: The first slat on the seat has a crack in it. Picture attached. Hoping to get in touch with the seller. Update : haven’t been to get in touch with the seller. And now the second slat has also detached itself from the bench. Really bad quality product
customer_reviews.author: Mr338

customer_reviews.title: good product/terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The screw posts on the legs were not correct for the nuts supplied. It took them days to respond to my inquiry for assistance and when they did they want more information. By this time I had already just bought different nuts that worked just fine. The product itself is great but the customer service from Lifetime is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: dubbled21

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench to sit outside and relax.
customer_reviews.text: Love my glider bench. Purchased mine in 2015. It is my place to take my grandchildren (and myself) to read or just relax. One of the planks in the seat broke this winter. My husband called to get a replacement. Lifetime replaced it at n/c and we had the new plank within days. I would recommend this bench to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Pingel

customer_reviews.title: Nice statement bench glider for our porch, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of the bench glider for our porch and I received so many compliments from our family, guests and neighbors. It has been through all type of weather since I received it and I don’t see any rust on the metal which is great but I do see light stains on the wood from one of our bench that has been exposed to heavy rain and melted snow I assume. Overall, our family enjoy our bench gliders!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Roman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This glider is not worth the money! When it first arrived one of the slats on the seat was broken.Amazon did replace. Now 1 month later many of the screws that hold the slats are popping off. Because it has been over 1month,we have to fix it ourselves. Maybe if This glider sat on a porch and was never used it would stay nice but we have it in our deck.This glider looks nice but it is a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Ripka

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: This is my second glider. I purchased my first one 7 yrs ago and it’s held up super well and never had any issues. My only problem is that one of the slats came broken. We are in the middle of COVID19 and no customer service representative is available to Solve this issue
customer_reviews.author: Maria S. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great Hardware - Terrible Attachments for Slats
customer_reviews.text: Two slats on the bench started warping and popping off after 1 week in partial sun. The frame is very good and I will replace the slats with cedar. The screws attaching the slats broke in half. I am sure that eventually they will all break.
customer_reviews.author: Terry in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and cute
customer_reviews.text: How much sturdier than other similar benches I’d shopped at similar price points. Put it together all by myself in <90 minutes with only minimal profanity and no damage to manicure... And no, I am not mechanically inclined. Very attractive, nice smooth glide. You couldn’t take a nap on it, but it’s just right for sitting on the porch watching the world go by.
customer_reviews.author: Kabeenie

customer_reviews.title: It's fine resting on a solid patio but on stone or ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. No issues with the install. The composite wood is pre-assembled so all you're really doing is putting sides onto the bases. My only concern is the low lie of the glider bottom. It's fine resting on a solid patio but on stone or grass the glides will bottom out. I placed a brick under each foot to provide clearance. It's still a 5 star product. I've had two large adults sit on it without the slightest concern.
customer_reviews.author: jason dobe

customer_reviews.title: Happy Ending For Me
customer_reviews.text: The first bench I received had major factory defects. After complaining to Amazon they went above and beyond to make it right for me. Now I have a replacement bench that is awesome. It was easy to construct and very sturdy. I love my new bench!
customer_reviews.author: D. Fadden

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for two years on our back deck. It was great at first, but over time several of the slats have popped up which is deeply disappointing. Also water gets trapped inside the bench, starts to rust, and drips out when moved - staining our deck and ruining an outdoor rug. I had much higher hopes for this given the price. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bench for over a year. It sits by a small natural area and is exposed to the weather in NC. This is my place to sit outside in the sunshine during the colder months but is used all year long. It looks good. Gets high reviews from visitors. Is very comfortable.Easy to assemble especially with 2 people. Glides smoothly. Does not get overly hot in the sun to where it would cause discomfort when used. Powder coated paint held up well. No complaints. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good at first but slats are popping after only two months
customer_reviews.text: The look is good and at first it seemed sturdy. But after only two months with little use, two slats are already popping. Disappointing that now we need to do repair to something we paid good money for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime yard furniture is the best.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect glider: sturdy,well-built and easy to assemble. Have had other Lifetime products and am always impressed by how perfectly they are crafted. I have a Lifetime cart that I have used for over ten years ( I pull it behind my lawn tractor) and it’s the sturdiest cart I’ve ever owned. I appreciate good quality yard equipment. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice glider for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to assemble, sturdy and seats 2 adults easily. Smooth gliding. Seems to stand up to weather elements in sunlight and rain - no rusting. Doesn't hurt your back after sitting for a long period of time. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: I want my money back!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the money. The seat broke within 2 weeks. the screw broke off so it cannot be repaired. I want my money back. We did not even sit on this regularly!!! What is going on with this shoddy workmanship. A bench like this should not be sold!! Please contact me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee R Wiesner

customer_reviews.title: It’s made well.
customer_reviews.text: I love my glider. It works great and its made very well. I bought a cover to shield it from the elements when not I use. I would recommend this highly! Looks great too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bench
customer_reviews.text: Bench is well made and sturdy. I Love the material it's made of. Very strong and great looking material. It is easy to assemble. I look forward to enjoying it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: scooby doo in LA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accent to my front porch!
customer_reviews.text: Love my slider. Didn't want just a park bench, so this glider was perfect and serviceable for me! Was a little difficult to assemble, so we hired a handyman, he didn't have a bit of a trouble!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Scratches easily
customer_reviews.text: Glides smoothly and sits comfortably; however, scratches easily and one of the seat boards needs to be reattached after only a few uses by people weighing less than 180. Not as happy as I thought I'd be based on numerous positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Sm

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service BLOWS~
customer_reviews.text: After receiving and unpacking this product on July 3, I noticed the bottom seat portion of the bench had a split in one of the boards. I sent two emails to the seller via the Amazon Contact Seller button. After not hearing back from them I filled a Warranty Claim on their website. That was July 13. Today, July 17, I tried several times to call them and can't seem to get anyone to answer.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: It's actually a pretty good glider once you get it assembled
customer_reviews.text: It's actually a pretty good glider once you get it assembled. However, be aware that it was made in China and the assembly instructions read like they were written by a Chinese person not totally fluent in English. So you have to study the parts and figure out how they fit together before you start to assemble it. The faux wood slats are hard plastic, but that's good if you plan to leave the glider outside in the weather. Overall it seems pretty solid. I'm waiting to see if the metal parts eventually show any rust, but so far they don't.
customer_reviews.author: Alan RC

customer_reviews.title: Great bench and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bench as a gift. I helped assemble it and there were two boards with cracks. I called the company and they shipped replacements asap. Great customer service and a great bench.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have one that’s 7 years old and I love it. In our move my older one had a missing piece. I was able to order anew part. I needed a second one. It really needs 2 people to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Perdue

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bench 15 months ago it’s been sitting outside in the Florida sun ever cents and it still looks like the day I bought it if you’re looking for a good bench bye this bench you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: William Fobare

customer_reviews.title: Metal Frame Rusting in Less Than 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: This is a great glider! It is made of decent quality materials, it is comfortable, and it looks very nice. 9/16/2016 UPDATE: While this seemed like a great glider initially, it has now been just over two months since receiving it and the metal frame has already started to rust. In less than 3 months, it is rusting. Not happy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench with very clear instructions for assembly. Well packaged but did have a broken board.
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged and instructions were a breeze to follow for assembly. One of the boards on the seat portion was cracked. Called seller and they sent new board to replace. Had to remove old board from seat and screw in new. Very comfortable and looks great in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is much more substantial than I imagined. Once put together it feels solid and looks like a much more expensive product. I bought without cushions and it is still comfortable. Dries quickly after the rain. IF YOU Are patient it is not difficult to put together, even by yourself, although 2 people would make this a breeze to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Bel Canto Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Not So Fast, Pardner
customer_reviews.text: the bench looks fine and seems ok. however, be advised: it takes two full people to put the thing together. also, one of the embedded screws-- crucial to the assembly-- arrived stripped. i had to call a mechanic friend to come over with a special tool to file it down and re-thread the screw. fortunately, it didn't cost me anything, but it did arrive defective.
customer_reviews.author: M. Markowitz

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: GARBAGE!! Had for less than a month, used twice and screws holding “wood” slats on seats broke causing slats to bow up in 3 places. Much poorer quality than our Adirondack chairs from the same maker. So terrible product and I have the awful hassle of trying to get it to a UPS store for return. Very disappointed but at least covid-19 return window was long enough to send it back in time. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L Barr

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my glider since 2013 and it is just as awesome as the day I put it on my front deck. It has been through some wicked weather - heat, severe rain storms, humidity and its one of the only pieces of garden furniture that's stayed in great shape. Love it, love it, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Link

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: After a month outdoors, the plastic boards have started to warp. The small screws holding them to the metal have rusted to pieces. I won't be buying anything else from Lifetime... cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: Te Es

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bench. However, the screws at the bottom are snapping one by one, and the boards are loose now. I called customer service a couple of times but it is hard to get someone on the line with COVID restrictions. We were hesitant about the reviews online and we got the bench anyways. That was a mistake looking back...
customer_reviews.author: G. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: I only have had the bench for a couple of months and one of the boards on the seat have popped up and another one is starting to do it also.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Perfection at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This took about 90 minutes to assemble. The glide is smooth and silent. The materials are good quality and will not require any maintenance. It is better than expected and perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Brewer

customer_reviews.title: One thing would be VERY useful: the included tools are almost useless
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife for her birthday. assemble by one person is a bit problematic. Two makes it much easier. But I wanted to surprise her, so I'm not complaining. One thing would be VERY useful: the included tools are almost useless. To print the wrench size and recommended screw driver and hex wrench size in the assembly instructions would be terrific. It's very nice.
customer_reviews.author: George McRae

customer_reviews.title: Item was actually easily assembled by one person
customer_reviews.text: Item was actually easily assembled by one person. However, there were absolutely no instructions included at all. It is not much trouble putting together (even without instructions) if you study the color image on the box label. Time will tell how it holds up with year round weather extremes. It seems sturdy enough to handle all weather situations and it has no wood components to rot. If you are assembling it with only one person it is best to assemble it in the area where you plan on leaving the bench. It is quite heavy and awkward to move around after it is put together.
customer_reviews.author: SCJ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not the best quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble but definitely need 2 people. Comfortable and I enjoy it, however, after only a month and a half the planks are popping up. Might have to try gluing them down.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina Jodi Mazer

customer_reviews.title: Weak Materials
customer_reviews.text: Our benches have both started to crack in the boards and the screws have started to break off in the boards causing the boards to dislodge from the bench itsself. We have only sat on these benches a handful of times and they did not Crack while we were sitting on them, we came outside to notice that they were cracked. Very disappointed in the quality especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Janney

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Glider Sunday June 30th. It arrived today. I was able to put it together with tools provided. It would have gone faster had I had my own tools but didn't. I like it and will be reading my bible on it. No company needs to supply anyone with tools to put their product together. Yes instructions could have been better but I prayed for Jesus to help me and he did. I love it. Soon I'll be getting 2 Convertible benches from them and that will give me either 2 more benches to my yard or 1 full size picnic table. I think Lifetime now has a new customer.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Miley

customer_reviews.title: Lovely glider
customer_reviews.text: This was packaged beautifully and no damage noted upon arrival. We originally ordered this because I had seen a friend's and admired its workmanship and durability. We received ours, put it together and for some reason, within a day, one of the manufactured slats was broken. We hadn't used it at all. We contacted the manufacturer and they promptly shipped out a new slat. They definitely get 5 stars for customer service but I would've rather not had to replace a slat days after we received the new product.
customer_reviews.author: chikkeninthemist

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Sliders have handled 500 pounds without breaking. It's been on my back patio in full sunlight open to rain for three years, and only one of the slats of the seat has come up and won't rest under the dark brown moulding anymore.
customer_reviews.author: L. Eve Engelbrite

customer_reviews.title: Broken Pieces from Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: The screw posts that attach to the glider came mangled. It appears when they manufactured it they hit the posts with a hammer so the nuts won't screw onto the posts. Will call company in morning, if they don't replace ASAP it will be going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JakeG

customer_reviews.title: Great bench, just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Great bench, just what I wanted. Not hard to put together except that the directions for installing the Bearing Arms are somewhat confusing.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old wooden glider, works like a charm. Very happy with the choice we made.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Minue

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice bench. Took my husband and I one hour to put together but we used our own tools. I think it would have been harder just using the tools they provided. Instructions were easy to follow and everything lined up nicely. We bought this as a gift for my inlaws and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dano's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Well built and ideal for a small space
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying this glider in our small porch space. It wasn't too difficult for my husband and I to put together, but it does take two people. Very good quality and it enhances the look to our front porch. Good curb appeal!
customer_reviews.author: Joy M. Albins

customer_reviews.title: Easy Gliding
customer_reviews.text: Love this glider. Our two grandsons (12 & 14) put it together in under 20 minutes. The resin slats will never need to be painted, the iron has a nice finish on it. We have it sitting on concrete porch and is getting lots of use.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Irby

customer_reviews.title: Bad welding lasted less than year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glider bench on Sept 7 2013. By early August 2014 one of the welding connections that holds the seat bench to the arm busted apart so now when you sit on it, it sags. Also the paint on the arms is bad and already bubbling up and peeling not to mention beginning to rust. They do have a 2 year limited warranty so we'll see if they will replace this bench or not.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: ... money to purchase something in remembrance of a very good friend that died
customer_reviews.text: My family gave me money to purchase something in remembrance of a very good friend that died. She loved to sit and watch her animals. It took me a year of looking before I settled on this glider. It's perfect. Easy to assemble. Heavy Duty and looks good next to our barn. This is a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S.

customer_reviews.title: High quality bench
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a glider for the front yard that was going to look good and last for years. This bench satisfied both of those requirements. The finish on the metal seems durable, and the fact that there is no wood to maintain means this is going to look good without having to spend hours sanding and refinishing. The faux wood slats seem to be easy to scratch, if you aren't careful about who sits on it (large dogs for example) but for us this hasn't proven to be too much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Very nice appearance but one leg bent inward
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking bench/glider with simulated wood slats. These won't fade or splinter over age and won't require restaining. Only complaint was one leg got bent in the shipping and looks awkward. It's comfortable and just the right size for two. Not a lot of movement in the glide - only a few inches - but enough to give you a nice rocking motion.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Musil

customer_reviews.title: nice!  Sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: nice! Sturdy and comfortable. The tan blanks hardly look like wood but are fine. I was able to assemble myself in about an hour. (disclosure: 69 year old woman accountant) I was especially impressed with the small parts shrink wrapped on cardboard, the clear instructions and the careful packing.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very nice glider bench!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great glider bench for my front porch! It took a couple hours for two people to put together, but it was worth the trouble. It's very comfortable and easy to clean. I think it will last several years! I found the price on Amazon to beat the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: VegasShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This was everything I expected and more - comfortable, easy to assemble & sturdy. The price was within reason. Replaced an older wooden glider - this will last much longer than the 15 years of Illinois winters outside.
customer_reviews.author: Diane B Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this bench. It’s comfortable with the cushion we bought for it. Had a friend ask about it and he was going to buy one just like it, but his wife overrode and they got another one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Christman

customer_reviews.title: Screws are not galvanized
customer_reviews.text: Well disappointed. It is supposed to be an outdoor bench. We purchased in May 2020. It has been in use less than 2 months and one if the screws has already rusted and broken in half
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Sekel

customer_reviews.title: Relatively easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to put together. All of the pieces fit just as they were intended to, unlike some of those products that have to be forced to fit. Sturdy, looks good, and works well. Seating position is comfortable, although one has to accept the fact that it is a hard surface. Could add cushions, but we haven't tried that. It is exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Louis L.

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: We get a lot of use of this , looks great, holds a lot of weight,two big adults with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Micheau

customer_reviews.title: Wish it hadn’t arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: When the package was delivered, all of the tape was busted and the only thing holding it together was a thin plastic strap. The box was pretty beat up, and a portion of the arm was broken off, as shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Lady F

customer_reviews.title: I need help in solving the problem
customer_reviews.text: The screws are breaking off and the boards are bowing.
customer_reviews.author: CJB

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it nice to not have to stain this every year, but it doesn't attract termites and other wood eaters. Putting it together was easy, although the instructions were not the best. I used my power drill with to tighten the various bolts. The tool they give you is a joke. you will need two people to put this together since some of the parts need to be held in place while inserting the bolts through the holes from one piece to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, reasonably priced glider for a porch or yard.
customer_reviews.text: This bench came quickly and was relatively a straight forward assembly. It glides well and is light enough to easily move around with two people. It appears to be of a quality build that should last for a reasonable amount of time out in the elements. It looks good like wood without the downsides to wood of fading, chipping, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Kennelly

customer_reviews.title: Still great after 2 yrs. Sturdy, smooth & no rust.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for two years and still love it. It’s been outside in the elements on my patio and now my porch and hasn’t rusted or faded. Bird poop, etc. comes off easily with a good washing. It was fairly easy to put together and it’s pretty easy to move, although it’s awkward for one person alone. Sturdy with a smooth, short glide that puts my baby to sleep & is ok for my 4yo son to sit on alone.
customer_reviews.author: Tea&Books42

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Comfortable, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my glider bench. The instructions could have been clearer and I found that it helped to use my own tools instead of the little ones provided but I was able to do it myself. The bench itself is very attractive. It's not real wood but looks a lot like real wood and I have the piece of mind that it won't age and develop splinters. I'm 5'3" and I find it very comfortable. I would highly recommend this bench.
customer_reviews.author: fotogal13

customer_reviews.title: My favorite outdoor chair!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite chair on the patio. Everyone wants to sit in the rocker and sometimes we have to flip a coin to see who gets to sit in it. This chair is very durable to the elements. My sprinklers soak this thing weekly and the sun. There is no visible wear or color fading and works so well for a rocker. I intend to purchase another for my front patio and possible a third for the back patio as everyone wants to sit on it instead of the lounging chairs.
customer_reviews.author: John Wagner

customer_reviews.title: I recommend a seat cushion for extra comfort
customer_reviews.text: Come join me on my patio. A little work putting together, but product was just as pictured. I recommend a seat cushion for extra comfort.
customer_reviews.author: R Brown

customer_reviews.title: Glider heaven
customer_reviews.text: I love my glider bench. Morning coffee on the front porch is so relaxing as is the evenings wine before dinner and or after dinner! Dogs love to sit and glide with me too. So relaxing!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene I. Corso

customer_reviews.title: This is actually better made than I expected !
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 2 hours to assemble, but the directions are pictures only, no words, so it was easy enough to do. The back & seat are already assembled, so that made it a LOT easier. Well made. My only complaint is that it 'swings' too fast for my tastes. It doesn't go very far in either direction, so it's a short fast trip. I want a nice SLOW rocking motion & this is pretty energetic. Ah well, you can't have everything.
customer_reviews.author: GrammaNature

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, sturdy glider. It has a curved seat and back that makes it very comfortable. It was fairly easy to put together, tho one person may not find it easy at all. The fasteners (screws, nuts, etc) were very clearly marked and shrink wrapped on a card, as opposed to being all jumbled together in one bag, as so many seem to be. Well-made and worth the money! I recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: L. Munk

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, long lasting. Looks exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: We live in Pacific NW. Have had this 2 1/2 years. Still looks great. Very good quality. Well worth the money. We do store it in the winter though.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Glider Bench
customer_reviews.text: We love this glider bench! It's comfortable and good looking. The manufacturer needs to work on their packaging because we had to return the first one due to a broken back piece. The second one was perfect! The tools might work but my husband put it together much faster using a Ratchet Wrench, long handled Phillips screwdriver and long handled Hex wrench. Including unpacking and assembly it took less than an hour to be up and in use.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Kopenski

product_meta.title: LIFETIME 60290 Wood Alternative Glider Bench, Mocha Brown
product_meta.description: Color:Mocha BrownCreating the perfect place to enjoy a nice afternoon, the Lifetime Glider Bench is the ideal addition to your yard. Constructed of weather-resistant polystyrene simulated wood, the bench is designed to be the perfect size to easily fit on a porch or patio. The Lifetime Glider Bench is UV-protected and will not fade, crack, chip, or peel. Unlike wooden benches, the polystyrene will not splinter or warp, and never needs to be painted or varnished. The ball bearings create a smooth, quiet glide, and the 48 in. steel frame has a powder-coated, rust-resistant finish to ensure that your Glider Bench will last for years. Features a 44 in. weather-resistant polystyrene simulated wood bench (mocha brown) and 48 in. Bronze powder-coated steel frame. 2-year limited warranty.

The beauty of wood without the maintenance
